section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Third party payor" means any person that administers or provides reimbursement for hospital benefits on an expense incurred basis including:
A health maintenance organization issued a certificate of authority in accordance with Subtitle 7 of this title;
A health insurer or nonprofit health service plan authorized to offer health insurance policies or contracts in this State in accordance with the Insurance Article; or
A third party administrator registered under the Insurance Article.
"Uniform claims form" means the claim or billing form for reimbursement of hospital services adopted by the Insurance Commissioner under § 15-1003 of the Insurance Article.

text.section: When submitting a claim or bill for reimbursement to a third party payor, a hospital shall use the uniform claims form.

The uniform claims form submitted under this section:
Shall be properly completed; and
May be submitted by electronic transfer.
The Secretary may impose a penalty not to exceed $500 on any hospital that violates the provisions of this section.
